title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. Part II of the Extradition Act 1965 (No. 17 of 1965) shall apply in relation
text_raw:
2. Part II of the Extradition Act 1965 (No. 17 of 1965) shall apply in relation 

to the United Arab Emirates. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 27th May, 2025.

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: TREATY ON EXTRADITION BETWEEN IRELAND AND THE
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

TREATY ON EXTRADITION BETWEEN IRELAND AND THE 
UNITED ARAB EMIRATES 

done at Abu Dhabi on 21 October 2024 

Ireland 

and 

the United Arab Emirates (hereinafter referred to as “the Parties”) 

DESIRING to promote effective cooperation between the two countries in the 
suppression of crimes, on the basis of mutual respect for sovereignty and mutual 
benefit; 

HAVING DUE REGARD for their obligations to respect human rights and the 
rule of law; 

CONSCIOUS of the need to respect human dignity and recalling the rights 
conferred upon every person involved in criminal proceedings, as embodied in 
international instruments on human rights; 

MINDFUL of the guarantees under their respective legal systems, which provide 
an accused person with the right to a fair trial, including the right to adjudication 
by an impartial tribunal established pursuant to law; 

PURSUANT to the prevailing laws of the respective Parties; 

HAVE AGREED as follows: 

Article 1 
Obligation to extradite 

Each Party agrees to extradite to the other, upon request subject to the provisions 
of this Treaty any person who is found in the territory of the Requested Party 
and is wanted in the Requesting Party for prosecution, trial or execution of a 
sentence in respect of an extraditable offence committed within the jurisdiction 
of the Requesting Party. 

Article 2 
Extraditable offences
text_norm: schedule treaty extradition ireland united arab emirate done abu dhabi 21 october 2024 ireland united arab emirate (hereinafter referred party ) desiring promote effective cooperation two country suppression crime basis mutual respect sovereignty mutual benefit due regard obligation respect human right rule law conscious need respect human dignity recalling right conferred upon every person involved criminal proceeding embodied international instrument human right mindful guarantee respective legal system provide accused person right fair trial including right adjudication impartial tribunal established pursuant law pursuant prevailing law respective party agreed follows article 1 obligation extradite party agrees extradite upon request subject provision treaty person found territory requested party wanted requesting party prosecution trial execution sentence respect extraditable offence committed within jurisdiction requesting party article 2 extraditable offence

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: In accordance with the provisions of this Treaty, extradition shall be
text_raw:
1. 

In accordance with the provisions of this Treaty, extradition shall be 

granted when: 

the request for extradition is made to carry out criminal 
a) 
proceedings and the offence is punishable, pursuant to the law of both 
Parties, by a sentence of at least one year. 

the request for extradition is made for executing a final sentence 
b) 
for an offence punishable pursuant to the law of both Parties and, at the 

 
 
 
 
 4 [205] 

moment of submission of the request, the length of the sentence still to be 
served is at least six months.
text_norm: 1 accordance provision treaty extradition shall granted request extradition made carry criminal a) proceeding offence punishable pursuant law party sentence least one year request extradition made executing final sentence b) offence punishable pursuant law party 4 205 moment submission request length sentence still served least six month

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: In determining whether an offence is an offence punishable under the
text_raw:
2. 

In determining whether an offence is an offence punishable under the 

laws of both Parties, it shall not matter whether: 

a) 
the laws of the Parties place the acts or omissions constituting the 
offence within the same category of offence or denominate the offence by 
the same terminology; 

b) 
under the laws of the Parties the constituent elements of the 
offence differ, it being understood that the totality of the acts or omissions 
as presented by the Requesting Party shall be taken into account.
text_norm: 2 determining whether offence offence punishable law party shall matter whether a) law party place act omission constituting offence within category offence denominate offence terminology b) law party constituent element offence differ understood totality act omission presented requesting party shall taken account

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. For the purposes of this Treaty, offences connected with taxes, duties,
text_raw:
3. For the purposes of this Treaty, offences connected with taxes, duties, 
customs or exchange control shall be extraditable offences. Extradition shall not 
be refused on the ground that the rules or laws relating to taxes, duties, customs 
or exchange control that apply in the Requesting Party differ in nature from the 
rules or laws that apply to taxes, duties, customs or exchange control in the 
Requested Party.
text_norm: 3 purpose treaty offence connected tax duty custom exchange control shall extraditable offence extradition shall refused ground rule law relating tax duty custom exchange control apply requesting party differ nature rule law apply tax duty custom exchange control requested party

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If the request for extradition includes several separate offences, each of
text_raw:
4. 

If the request for extradition includes several separate offences, each of 
which is punishable under the laws of both Parties, but some of which do not 
fulfil the other conditions set out in paragraph 1 of this Article, the Requested 
Party may grant extradition for the latter offences, provided that the person is to 
be extradited for at least one of these offences.
text_norm: 4 request extradition includes several separate offence punishable law party fulfil condition set paragraph 1 article requested party may grant extradition latter offence provided person extradited least one offence

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 5. For the purposes of paragraph 1 of this Article, extradition shall be
text_raw:
5. For the purposes of paragraph 1 of this Article, extradition shall be 
granted also if the offence for which it is requested was committed outside of the 
territory of the Requesting Party, provided that the laws of the Requested Party 
allow the prosecution of an offence of the same nature committed outside of its 
territory. 

Article 3 
Mandatory grounds for refusal 

Extradition shall not be granted if: 

the offence for which it is requested is a political offence or an 
a) 
offence connected with a political offence. In the application of the 
provisions of this Treaty the following offences shall not be considered as 
political offences: 

i) assault on the President or his or her Deputy or Head of 
Government of either Party or any member of his or her family or 
any member of the Supreme Council of the State of the United Arab 
Emirates or of a member of such a person’s family; 

ii) terrorist offences; 

 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 5 

iii) any other offence not considered as a political offence under any 
international treaty, convention or agreement to which the Requested 
Party adheres; 

the Requested Party has substantial grounds for believing that the 
b) 
request for extradition has been made for the purpose of prosecuting or 
punishing the person sought for reasons of race, religion, ethnic origin, 
nationality, language, political opinions, sex or status or that the person’s 
position in the criminal proceedings may be prejudiced for any of those 
reasons; 

c) 
when the offence for which extradition is sought is punishable by 
death under the laws of the Requesting Party and is not punishable by death 
under the laws of the Requested Party, the Requested Party shall refuse to 
grant extradition unless a sentence of capital punishment is not imposed 
on the person sought, or if for procedural reasons such condition cannot be 
complied with by the Requesting Party, the Requesting Party provides a 
written undertaking that the death penalty if imposed shall not be carried 
out. If the Requesting Party accepts extradition under the conditions of this 
paragraph, it shall comply with such conditions. If the Requesting Party 
does not accept the conditions, the request for extradition shall be denied; 

d) 
the Requested Party has substantial grounds for believing that the 
person whose extradition is requested has been or would be subjected in 
the Requesting Party to torture or cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment, 
or to proceedings which do not ensure the respect of basic defence rights; 

e) 
the judgment of the Requesting Party has been rendered in 
absentia and the convicted person has not had sufficient notice of the trial 
or was not given the opportunity to arrange for his or her defence and has 
not had or will not have the opportunity to have the case retried in his or 
her presence; 

f) 
in respect of the offence for which extradition is requested, the 
person sought has already been tried with a final judgment by the 
competent authorities of the Requested Party; 

g) 
the offence for which extradition is requested falls within the 
jurisdiction of the Requested Party under its own criminal law and the 
criminal prosecution or punishment of the requested person is statutebarred according to the law of the Requested Party; 

h) 
the offence for which extradition is requested constitutes solely a 
military offence under the laws of the Requested Party and is not also an 
offence under ordinary criminal law; 

i) 
the Requested Party deems that granting extradition could 
jeopardise its sovereignty, security, public order or other essential interests 
or cause effects that are contrary to the fundamental principles of its 
national law; 

j) 
the principles of ne bis in idem. 

the execution of the request for extradition would be contrary to 

 
 6 [205] 

Article 4 
Discretionary grounds for refusal

sought procedural reason condition cannot complied requesting party requesting party provides written undertaking death penalty imposed shall carried out requesting party accepts extradition condition paragraph shall comply condition requesting party accept condition request extradition shall denied d) requested party substantial ground believing person whose extradition requested would subjected requesting party torture cruel inhuman degrading treatment proceeding ensure respect basic defence right e) judgment requesting party rendered absentia convicted person sufficient notice trial given opportunity arrange defence opportunity case retried presence f) respect offence extradition requested person sought already tried final judgment competent authority requested party g) offence title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. Extradition may be refused in any of the following circumstances:
text_raw:
1. Extradition may be refused in any of the following circumstances: 

the offence for which extradition is requested is subject to the 
a) 
jurisdiction of the Requested Party in accordance with its national law and 
the person sought is being prosecuted or is going to be prosecuted by the 
competent authorities of that Party for the same offence for which 
extradition is requested, or its competent authorities have decided either 
not to institute or to terminate proceedings against the person claimed in 
respect of the relevant offence; 

the Requested Party, while taking into consideration the 
b) 
seriousness of the offence and interests of the Requesting Party, considers 
that the extradition would not be compatible with humanitarian 
considerations in view of age and health conditions. 

Article 5 
Extradition of citizens

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The Requested Party shall, at the request of the Requesting Party, submit
text_raw:
2. The Requested Party shall, at the request of the Requesting Party, submit 
the case to its competent authority to consider the institution of criminal 
proceedings in accordance with its national law. For this purpose, the Requesting 
Party shall provide the Requested Party with documents and evidence relating to 
the case. The Requesting Party shall be notified of any action taken in this 
respect, upon its request. 

Article 6 
Central Authorities

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The Central Authorities may communicate directly after the request has
text_raw:
2. The Central Authorities may communicate directly after the request has 
been formally transmitted. Each of the Central Authorities may designate a focal

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. The request for extradition shall be made in written form and include the
text_raw:
3. The request for extradition shall be made in written form and include the 

following: 

a) 

the name of the requesting authority; 

b) 
full name of the person sought and, if available, details of his or 
her citizenship, place of residence or location, description of that person’s 
appearance, the photographs and fingerprints of that person, and any other 
details enabling the search for and identification of such person; 

c) 
a statement of the facts constituting the offence, including the 
time, place, conduct, their legal descriptions and consequences of the 
offence; 

d) 
jurisdiction, criminalisation and penalty of the offence; 

a statement of 

the applicable 

laws relating 

to criminal 

e) 
prosecution or execution of sentence; 

a statement of the applicable laws relating to time limit on 

f) 
if the request for extradition is made for the purpose of 
conducting criminal proceedings against the person sought, the request 
shall also be accompanied by an original or an authentic copy of the 
warrant of arrest or other document having the same force awarded in the 
forms prescribed by law issued by the competent authority of the 
Requesting Party; 

g) 
if the request for extradition is made for the purpose of executing 
a sentence imposed on the person sought, the request shall also be 
accompanied by an original or an authentic copy of the final judgment 
indicating that the judgment has entered into force and a description of the 
period of sentence which has already been executed.
text_norm: 3 request extradition shall made written form include following a) name requesting authority b) full name person sought available detail citizenship place residence location description person appearance photograph fingerprint person detail enabling search identification person c) statement fact constituting offence including time place conduct legal description consequence offence d) jurisdiction criminalisation penalty offence statement applicable law relating criminal e) prosecution execution sentence statement applicable law relating time limit f) request extradition made purpose conducting criminal proceeding person sought request shall also accompanied original authentic copy warrant arrest document force awarded form prescribed law issued competent authority requesting party g) request extradition made purpose executing sentence imposed person sought request shall also accompanied original authentic copy final judgment indicating judgment entered force description period sentence already executed

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. The letter of request for extradition and other relevant documents
text_raw:
4. The letter of request for extradition and other relevant documents 
submitted by the Requesting Party in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2 of this 
Article shall be officially signed or sealed by the competent authority of the 
Requesting Party and be accompanied by a translation into the language of the 
Requested Party unless both Parties have agreed otherwise. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [205] 

Article 8 
Additional information

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If the information provided by the Requesting Party in support of a
text_raw:
1. 

If the information provided by the Requesting Party in support of a 
request for extradition is not sufficient to enable the Requested Party to reach a 
decision under this Treaty, the Requested Party may request that the necessary 
additional information be submitted within forty-five (45) days.
text_norm: 1 information provided requesting party support request extradition sufficient enable requested party reach decision treaty requested party may request necessary additional information submitted within forty-five (45) day

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. Failure to submit the additional information within the time limit
text_raw:
2. Failure to submit the additional information within the time limit 
indicated in paragraph 1 of this Article amounts to renouncing the request for 
extradition. However, the Requesting Party shall not be precluded from making 
a new request for extradition of the same person and for the same offence.
text_norm: 2 failure submit additional information within time limit indicated paragraph 1 article amount renouncing request extradition however requesting party shall precluded making new request extradition person offence

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If the person whose surrender is sought is in custody and the additional
text_raw:
3. 

If the person whose surrender is sought is in custody and the additional 
information furnished is not sufficient in accordance with this Treaty or is not 
received within the time specified, the person may be released from custody. 
However, the Requesting Party shall not be precluded from making a new 
request for extradition of the same person and for the same offence.

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. Where the person is released from custody in accordance with paragraph
text_raw:
4. Where the person is released from custody in accordance with paragraph 

3, the requested Party shall promptly notify the Requesting Party. 

Article 9 
Rule of specialty
text_norm: 4 person released custody accordance paragraph 3 requested party shall promptly notify requesting party article 9 rule specialty

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. The person extradited in compliance with this Treaty shall not be
text_raw:
1. The person extradited in compliance with this Treaty shall not be 
prosecuted, tried, or detained for the purpose of executing a sentence in the 
Requesting Party, or subjected to any other measure restricting personal liberty, 
for any offence committed before being surrendered and different from the one 
for which extradition is granted, unless: 

a) 
Requesting Party, voluntarily returns to it; 

the person extradited, after having left the territory of the 

b) 
the person extradited does not leave the territory of the 
Requesting Party within forty-five (45) days after having had the 
opportunity to do so. However, such period of time shall not include the 
time during which said person fails to leave the Requesting Party for 
reasons beyond his or her control; 

c) 
upon specific request by the Requesting Party, the Requested 
Party may agree to the Requesting Party prosecuting the person extradited 
or executing a sentence against him or her for an offence different from 
that for which the request for extradition has been made, in compliance 
with the conditions and restrictions set by this Treaty. In this respect: 

i) the Requested Party may ask the Requesting Party to transmit the 
documents and information indicated in Articles 7 and 8; 

 
 
 
 
 [205] 9 

ii) while awaiting the decision on the request made, the person 
extradited may be kept in detention by the Requesting Party 
according to its national law.

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. When the legal classification of the offence charged is modified during
text_raw:
2. When the legal classification of the offence charged is modified during 
the proceedings, the person extradited may be prosecuted and tried for the 
offence differently denominated, provided that extradition is permitted under 
this Treaty also for the new offence. 

Article 10 
Re-extradition to a third party 

Except in the cases provided for in Article 9(1)(a) and (b), the Requesting Party 
cannot surrender to a third Party, without the consent of the Requested Party, the 
person that has been surrendered to it and is requested by the third Party for 
offences committed before such surrender. The Requested Party may ask for the 
submission of the documents and information indicated in Articles 7 and 8. 

Article 11 
Provisional arrest
text_norm: 2 legal classification offence charged modified proceeding person extradited may prosecuted tried offence differently denominated provided extradition permitted treaty also new offence article 10 re-extradition third party except case provided article 9(1)(a) (b) requesting party cannot surrender third party without consent requested party person surrendered requested third party offence committed surrender requested party may ask submission document information indicated article 7 8 article 11 provisional arrest

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: In case of urgency, the Requesting Party may ask for the provisional
text_raw:
1. 

In case of urgency, the Requesting Party may ask for the provisional 
arrest of the person sought prior to submitting the request for extradition. The 
request for provisional arrest shall be made in writing through the Central 
Authorities designated pursuant to Article 6 of this Treaty, the International 
Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL) or other channels agreed upon by 
both Parties. The Central Authority of the Requested Party may accept the 
request by e-mail or by any other means capable of producing a written record.
text_norm: 1 case urgency requesting party may ask provisional arrest person sought prior submitting request extradition request provisional arrest shall made writing central authority designated pursuant article 6 treaty international criminal police organization (interpol) channel agreed upon party central authority requested party may accept request e-mail mean capable producing written record

full name of the person sought and, if available, details of his or 
a) 
her citizenship, place of residence or location, description of that person's 
appearance, the photographs and fingerprints of that person, and any other 
details enabling the search for and identification of such person; 

b) 

c) 

a statement as to why the matter is urgent; 

a statement of intention to submit a formal request for extradition; 

d) 
that person; 

the text of a warrant of arrest or a judgment of conviction against 

e) 
statement of the brief facts of the case. 

a statement of the offence and the penalty for that offence and a 

The Requested Party may ask for additional information.

text_raw:
3. Once the request for provisional arrest is received, the Requested Party 
shall take the measures necessary, in accordance with its national law, to secure

the arrest of the person sought and shall promptly inform the Requesting Party 
of the outcome of its request.

heading: If the Central Authority of the Requested Party does not receive the
text_raw:
4. 

If the Central Authority of the Requested Party does not receive the 
formal request for the extradition within the time frame specified in the national

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 5. A provisional arrest rendered ineffective pursuant to paragraph 4 of this
text_raw:
5. A provisional arrest rendered ineffective pursuant to paragraph 4 of this 
Article shall not prejudice the extradition of the person sought if the Requested 
Party subsequently receives the formal request for extradition in compliance 
with the conditions and restrictions of this Treaty. 

Article 12 
Concurrent requests 

If the Requested Party receives from the Requesting Party and from one or more 
third States a request for extradition of the same person, for the same offence or 
for different offences, the Requested Party, in determining to which State the 
person is to be extradited, shall consider, in accordance with its national law, all 
the relevant circumstances, in particular: 

a) 

b) 

c) 

d) 
sought; 

whether the requests were made pursuant to a treaty; 

the seriousness of the different offences; 

the time and place of commission of the offence; 

the nationality and the usual place of residence of the person 

e) 

the respective dates of submission of the requests. 

Article 13 
Surrender of persons

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If the Requested Party grants the extradition, it shall inform the
text_raw:
1. 

If the Requested Party grants the extradition, it shall inform the 
Requesting Party as soon as possible and the Parties shall agree promptly on the 
time, place and any other relevant matter relating to the surrender of the person 
sought. The Requesting Party shall also be informed of the length of the 
detention for extradition purposes of the person sought.
text_norm: 1 requested party grant extradition shall inform requesting party soon possible party shall agree promptly time place relevant matter relating surrender person sought requesting party shall also informed length detention extradition purpose person sought

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The time limit for surrendering the person sought shall be within thirty
text_raw:
2. The time limit for surrendering the person sought shall be within thirty 
(30) days from the date on which the Requesting Party is informed that the 
extradition has been granted.
text_norm: 2 time limit surrendering person sought shall within thirty (30) day date requesting party informed extradition granted

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If one of the Parties fails to surrender or take over the person to be
text_raw:
3. 

If one of the Parties fails to surrender or take over the person to be 
extradited within the agreed time limit for reasons beyond its control, the Party 
concerned shall inform the other Party and they shall agree together upon a new 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 11 

date for surrender. The provisions indicated in paragraph 4 of this Article shall 
continue to apply.
text_norm: 3 one party fails surrender take person extradited within agreed time limit reason beyond control party concerned shall inform party shall agree together upon new 205 11 date surrender provision indicated paragraph 4 article shall continue apply

heading: If, within the time limit indicated in paragraph 2 of this Article, the
text_raw:
4. 

If, within the time limit indicated in paragraph 2 of this Article, the 
Requesting Party does not take over the person to be extradited, the Requested 
Party shall immediately release him from custody and may refuse a new request 
for extradition made by the Requesting Party for that person for the same 
offence, except as otherwise provided for in paragraph 3 of this Article.

heading: 5. When the person to be extradited escapes back to the Requested Party
text_raw:
5. When the person to be extradited escapes back to the Requested Party 
before the criminal proceedings are concluded or the sentence is served in the 
Requesting Party, that person may be extradited again upon a new request for 
extradition made by the Requesting Party for the same offence. The Requesting 
Party does not need to submit the documents provided for in Article 7 of this 
Treaty.
text_norm: 5 person extradited escape back requested party criminal proceeding concluded sentence served requesting party person may extradited upon new request extradition made requesting party offence requesting party need submit document provided article 7 treaty

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 6. Time spent in deprivation of liberty between the date of arrest and the
text_raw:
6. Time spent in deprivation of liberty between the date of arrest and the 
date of surrender, shall be taken into account by the Requesting Party for the 
purposes of pre-trial custody within the criminal proceedings or of the sentence 
to be served in the cases provided for in Article 2(1)(b). 

Article 14 
Surrender of items
text_norm: 6 time spent deprivation liberty date arrest date surrender shall taken account requesting party purpose pre-trial custody within criminal proceeding sentence served case provided article 2(1)(b) article 14 surrender item

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. Upon request of the Requesting Party, the Requested Party shall in
text_raw:
1. Upon request of the Requesting Party, the Requested Party shall in 
compliance with its national law, seize the items found on its territory and which 
the person sought has at his or her disposal and, when extradition is granted, 
shall surrender those items to the Requesting Party. For the purposes of this 
Article the following items are subject to seizure and subsequent surrender to the 
Requesting Party: 

a) 
instrumentality that may serve as evidence; 

the items used to commit the offence or any other item or 

b) 
disposal of the person sought or have been discovered later. 

the items deriving from the offence that have been found at the
text_norm: 1 upon request requesting party requested party shall compliance national law seize item found territory person sought disposal extradition granted shall surrender item requesting party purpose article following item subject seizure subsequent surrender requesting party a) instrumentality may serve evidence item used commit offence item b) disposal person sought discovered later item deriving offence found

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The surrender of any of the items indicated in paragraph 1 shall be made
text_raw:
2. The surrender of any of the items indicated in paragraph 1 shall be made 
even when extradition, although already granted, cannot be effected due to the 
death, disappearance or escape of the person sought.
text_norm: 2 surrender item indicated paragraph 1 shall made even extradition although already granted cannot effected due death disappearance escape person sought

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. The Requested Party may, for the purpose of carrying out any other
text_raw:
3. The Requested Party may, for the purpose of carrying out any other 
pending criminal proceedings, postpone the surrender of the above-mentioned 
items until the conclusion of such proceedings or temporarily surrender them on 
condition that the Requesting Party undertakes to return them. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12 [205]
text_norm: 3 requested party may purpose carrying pending criminal proceeding postpone surrender above-mentioned item conclusion proceeding temporarily surrender condition requesting party undertakes return them 12 205

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. The surrender of the items indicated in this Article shall not prejudice
text_raw:
4. The surrender of the items indicated in this Article shall not prejudice 
any legitimate rights or interests over those items of the Requested Party or any 
third party. Where these rights or interests exist, the Requesting Party shall return 
free of charge to the Requested Party or third party the surrendered items, as 
soon as possible after the conclusion of the proceedings. 

Article 15 
Postponed and temporary surrender
text_norm: 4 surrender item indicated article shall prejudice legitimate right interest item requested party third party right interest exist requesting party shall return free charge requested party third party surrendered item soon possible conclusion proceeding article 15 postponed temporary surrender

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If a person whose extradition has been granted is, in the territory of the
text_raw:
1. 

If a person whose extradition has been granted is, in the territory of the 
Requested Party, being prosecuted for an offence other than that for which 
extradition has been sought or is serving a sentence for an offence other than that 
for which extradition has been sought, the Requested Party may postpone his or 
her extradition. Such a postponement may continue until the conclusion of such 
criminal proceedings or until the completion of service of such a sentence by this 
person. The Requested Party shall notify such a postponement to the Requesting 
Party.
text_norm: 1 person whose extradition granted territory requested party prosecuted offence extradition sought serving sentence offence extradition sought requested party may postpone extradition postponement may continue conclusion criminal proceeding completion service sentence person requested party shall notify postponement requesting party

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The Requested Party may also, upon request by the Requesting Party,
text_raw:
2. The Requested Party may also, upon request by the Requesting Party, 
temporarily surrender a person mentioned in paragraph 1 for the purpose of 
carrying out criminal proceedings. A person temporarily surrendered shall be 
kept in custody in the territory of the Requesting Party and returned to the 
Requested Party promptly and in conformity with conditions agreed upon by the 
Parties. The period of such a deprivation of liberty shall be credited towards the 
sentence to be served.
text_norm: 2 requested party may also upon request requesting party temporarily surrender person mentioned paragraph 1 purpose carrying criminal proceeding person temporarily surrendered shall kept custody territory requesting party returned requested party promptly conformity condition agreed upon party period deprivation liberty shall credited towards sentence served

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. Without prejudice to paragraph 1, the surrender of a person may also be
text_raw:
3. Without prejudice to paragraph 1, the surrender of a person may also be 
postponed if it may endanger the extradited person’s life due to his or her state 
of health. To this end, it is necessary that the Requested Party submit to the 
Requesting Party a medical report made by an expert or by a competent health 
institution. 

Article 16 
Consent to extradition
text_norm: 3 without prejudice paragraph 1 surrender person may also postponed may endanger extradited person life due state health end necessary requested party submit requesting party medical report made expert competent health institution article 16 consent extradition

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. When the person whose extradition is requested declares to agree to it,
text_raw:
1. When the person whose extradition is requested declares to agree to it, 
the Requested Party may, in accordance with its national law, surrender the 
person as expeditiously as possible. Extradition may be granted without it being 
necessary to submit the documents indicated in Article 7 of this Treaty. 
However, the Requested Party may request any further information it deems 
necessary to grant the extradition.
text_norm: 1 person whose extradition requested declares agree requested party may accordance national law surrender person expeditiously possible extradition may granted without necessary submit document indicated article 7 treaty however requested party may request information deems necessary grant extradition

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The declaration of consent by the person sought shall be valid if made
text_raw:
2. The declaration of consent by the person sought shall be valid if made 
before a competent authority of the Requested Party, who has the obligation to 
inform the person sought of the right to avail of a formal extradition procedure 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 13 

and of the right to avail of the protection conferred by the principle of specialty. 
The person sought may be assisted by defence counsel, in accordance with the 
national law of the Requested Party.
text_norm: 2 declaration consent person sought shall valid made competent authority requested party obligation inform person sought right avail formal extradition procedure 205 13 right avail protection conferred principle specialty person sought may assisted defence counsel accordance national law requested party

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. The declaration shall be reported in a legal record in which it is
text_raw:
3. The declaration shall be reported in a legal record in which it is 

acknowledged that the conditions for its being valid have been complied with.
text_norm: 3 declaration shall reported legal record acknowledged condition valid complied with

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. The provisions of Articles 9, 10 and 13 shall apply to a person
text_raw:
4. The provisions of Articles 9, 10 and 13 shall apply to a person 

surrendered pursuant to this Article. 

Article 17 
Decision
text_norm: 4 provision article 9 10 13 shall apply person surrendered pursuant article article 17 decision

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. The Requested Party shall decide on the request for extradition in
text_raw:
1. The Requested Party shall decide on the request for extradition in 
compliance with its national law and shall promptly inform the Requesting Party 
of its decision.
text_norm: 1 requested party shall decide request extradition compliance national law shall promptly inform requesting party decision

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: If the Requested Party refuses the whole or any part of the request for
text_raw:
2. 

If the Requested Party refuses the whole or any part of the request for 

extradition, the reasons for refusal shall be notified to the Requesting Party. 

Article 18 
Confidentiality
text_norm: 2 requested party refuse whole part request extradition reason refusal shall notified requesting party article 18 confidentiality

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. The Parties agree to keep the documents and any information used in the
text_raw:
1. The Parties agree to keep the documents and any information used in the 
extradition procedure confidential, to the greatest extent possible in accordance 
with national law and procedures, as well as any other information relevant to 
that extradition and acquired after the surrender of the person extradited.
text_norm: 1 party agree keep document information used extradition procedure confidential greatest extent possible accordance national law procedure well information relevant extradition acquired surrender person extradited

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. Both Parties undertake to respect and maintain the confidentiality or
text_raw:
2. Both Parties undertake to respect and maintain the confidentiality or 
secrecy of the documents or information received from or given to the other 
Party when there is an explicit request to do so by the Party concerned. 

Article 19 
Transit
text_norm: 2 party undertake respect maintain confidentiality secrecy document information received given party explicit request party concerned article 19 transit

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. Each Party may authorise transit through its territory of a person
text_raw:
1. Each Party may authorise transit through its territory of a person 
surrendered to the other Party by a third State, subject to the law of the Party of 
transit.
text_norm: 1 party may authorise transit territory person surrendered party third state subject law party transit

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The Party requesting the transit shall submit to the Party of transit,
text_raw:
2. The Party requesting the transit shall submit to the Party of transit, 
through the Central Authorities, or in particularly urgent cases through the 
International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL), a request containing 
the personal details of the person in transit and a concise statement of the facts 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14 [205] 

of the case. The request for transit shall be accompanied by a copy of the 
document granting the extradition.
text_norm: 2 party requesting transit shall submit party transit central authority particularly urgent case international criminal police organization (interpol) request containing personal detail person transit concise statement fact 14 205 case request transit shall accompanied copy document granting extradition

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. The Party of transit shall hold in custody the person in transit while said
text_raw:
3. The Party of transit shall hold in custody the person in transit while said 

person is on its territory.
text_norm: 3 party transit shall hold custody person transit said person territory

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. No authorisation for transit shall be required when air transportation is
text_raw:
4. No authorisation for transit shall be required when air transportation is 
used and no landing is scheduled on the territory of the Party of transit. If an 
unscheduled landing occurs in the territory of the aforementioned State, the Party 
requesting transit shall immediately inform the Party of transit and the latter 
shall, subject to its national law, hold the person to be transported for a maximum 
of 96 hours awaiting to receive the request for transit provided for in paragraph 
2 of this Article. 

Article 20 
Protection of personal data
text_norm: 4 authorisation transit shall required air transportation used landing scheduled territory party transit unscheduled landing occurs territory aforementioned state party requesting transit shall immediately inform party transit latter shall subject national law hold person transported maximum 96 hour awaiting receive request transit provided paragraph 2 article article 20 protection personal data

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. For the purpose of this Article data shall mean: all information relating
text_raw:
1. For the purpose of this Article data shall mean: all information relating 

to an identified or identifiable natural person.
text_norm: 1 purpose article data shall mean information relating identified identifiable natural person

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The Parties shall ensure that the data transferred from one Party to
text_raw:
2. The Parties shall ensure that the data transferred from one Party to 
another shall be used only for the purpose of executing a request, pursuant to this 
Treaty. No data shall be used for any other purpose, or transferred to any third 
country without prior approval of the Party that transferred the data.
text_norm: 2 party shall ensure data transferred one party another shall used purpose executing request pursuant treaty data shall used purpose transferred third country without prior approval party transferred data

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. The Parties shall ensure the accuracy of personal data transferred
text_raw:
3. The Parties shall ensure the accuracy of personal data transferred 
pursuant to this Treaty and they shall ensure that appropriate measures shall be 
taken in order to protect the transmitted data against accidental or unauthorised 
destruction or accidental loss as well as against unauthorised access, alteration 
or dissemination.
text_norm: 3 party shall ensure accuracy personal data transferred pursuant treaty shall ensure appropriate measure shall taken order protect transmitted data accidental unauthorised destruction accidental loss well unauthorised access alteration dissemination

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. The Parties shall consult each other on the desired time limits for storage,
text_raw:
4. The Parties shall consult each other on the desired time limits for storage, 
the necessity of any prolonged storage needed, as well as the need to rectify 
inaccurate, incomplete or unreliable data or the desire or need to erase data or to 
restrict the use of data.
text_norm: 4 party shall consult desired time limit storage necessity prolonged storage needed well need rectify inaccurate incomplete unreliable data desire need erase data restrict use data

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 5. To the extent regulated by the national law of the Parties, the data subject
text_raw:
5. To the extent regulated by the national law of the Parties, the data subject 
may be provided with information on the categories of data transferred and the 
purpose of the data transfer. The Party concerned may not inform the data subject 
if this is necessary to avoid obstructing official or legal enquiries, criminal or 
administrative investigations, prosecutions or the execution of criminal 
penalties, to protect public security, to protect national security, or to protect the 
rights and freedoms of others. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 15
text_norm: 5 extent regulated national law party data subject may provided information category data transferred purpose data transfer party concerned may inform data subject necessary avoid obstructing official legal enquiry criminal administrative investigation prosecution execution criminal penalty protect public security protect national security protect right freedom others 205 15

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 6. Parties shall consult each other if a judicial competent authority, pursuant
text_raw:
6. Parties shall consult each other if a judicial competent authority, pursuant 
to national law, makes any determination on the admissibility of the transfer of 
any data from one Party to another, pursuant to this Treaty. 

Article 21 
Expenses
text_norm: 6 party shall consult judicial competent authority pursuant national law make determination admissibility transfer data one party another pursuant treaty article 21 expense

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. All expenses related to the extradition shall be borne by the Party in
text_raw:
1. All expenses related to the extradition shall be borne by the Party in 

which territory they were incurred.
text_norm: 1 expense related extradition shall borne party territory incurred

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. The expenses incurred by reason of transit shall be borne by the
text_raw:
2. The expenses incurred by reason of transit shall be borne by the 

Requesting Party.
text_norm: 2 expense incurred reason transit shall borne requesting party

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: In case the said expenses are of an extraordinary nature, the Parties shall
text_raw:
3. 

In case the said expenses are of an extraordinary nature, the Parties shall 

consult with each other to settle the same. 

Article 22 
Settlement of disputes 

Any dispute arising from the implementation or interpretation of this Treaty shall 
be settled by consultations or negotiations between the Central Authorities of the 
Parties. Diplomatic channels may be used in the event that the Central 
Authorities are themselves unable to reach agreement. 

Article 23 
Compatibility with other treaties 

This Treaty shall not affect any existing obligations of the Parties in other 
treaties, nor prevent the Parties from providing assistance to each other pursuant 
to other treaties or arrangements. 

Article 24 
Entry into force, amendment and termination

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 1. This Treaty shall enter into force thirty (30) days after the date of receipt
text_raw:
1. This Treaty shall enter into force thirty (30) days after the date of receipt 
of the final notification in which the Parties inform each other, through 
diplomatic channels, that they have fulfilled the requirements of their national 
law for the entry into force of this Treaty.
text_norm: 1 treaty shall enter force thirty (30) day date receipt final notification party inform diplomatic channel fulfilled requirement national law entry force treaty

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 2. This Treaty may be amended by mutual consent of the Parties and the
text_raw:
2. This Treaty may be amended by mutual consent of the Parties and the 
amendment shall enter into force in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article.
text_norm: 2 treaty may amended mutual consent party amendment shall enter force accordance paragraph 1 article

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 3. Either Party may terminate this Treaty by notice in writing through
text_raw:
3. Either Party may terminate this Treaty by notice in writing through 
diplomatic channels at any time. Termination shall take effect six (6) months 
after the date on which the notice is given. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16 [205]
text_norm: 3 either party may terminate treaty notice writing diplomatic channel time termination shall take effect six (6) month date notice given 16 205

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 4. However, proceedings already commenced before the notice of
text_raw:
4. However, proceedings already commenced before the notice of 

termination shall continue to be governed by this Treaty until fully concluded.

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: 5. This Treaty shall apply to any request submitted after its entry into force,
text_raw:
5. This Treaty shall apply to any request submitted after its entry into force, 

even if the relevant offences were committed before its entry into force. 

IN WITNESS WHEREOF the undersigned, being duly authorised by their 
respective Governments, have signed this Treaty. 

DONE at Abu Dhabi this 21st day of October 2024, in duplicate, each in English 
and Arabic, both texts being equally authentic. In the event of any difference in 
interpretation of this Treaty, the English text shall prevail. 

FOR IRELAND 

FOR THE UNITED ARAB EMIRATES 

HELEN MCENTEE 

ABDULLAH BIN SULTAN BIN AWAD 
AL NUAIMI 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 May, 2025. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Minister for Foreign Affairs and Trade.

title: Emirates (the terms of which are set out in the Schedule to the following Order),
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The effect of this Order is to apply the provisions of Part II of the Extradition 
Act 1965 to the United Arab Emirates in respect of offences specified in Article 
2 of the Treaty on Extradition between Ireland and the United Arab Emirates, 
done at Abu Dhabi on 21 October 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 18 [205]
